text: Now the word [strongs id="h1697" /] of the LORD [strongs id="h3068" /] came unto Jonah [strongs id="h3124" /] the son [strongs id="h1121" /] of Amittai [strongs id="h0573" /], saying [strongs id="h0559" tvm="8800" /],

Arise [strongs id="h6965" tvm="8798" /], go [strongs id="h3212" tvm="8798" /] to Nineveh [strongs id="h5210" /], that great [strongs id="h1419" /] city [strongs id="h5892" /], and cry [strongs id="h7121" tvm="8798" /] against it; for their wickedness [strongs id="h7451" /] is come up [strongs id="h5927" tvm="8804" /] before [strongs id="h6440" /] me.

But Jonah [strongs id="h3124" /] rose up [strongs id="h6965" tvm="8799" /] to flee [strongs id="h1272" tvm="8800" /] unto Tarshish [strongs id="h8659" /] from the presence [strongs id="h6440" /] of the LORD [strongs id="h3068" /], and went down [strongs id="h3381" tvm="8799" /] to Joppa [strongs id="h3305" /]; and he found [strongs id="h4672" tvm="8799" /] a ship [strongs id="h0591" /] going [strongs id="h0935" tvm="8802" /] to Tarshish [strongs id="h8659" /]: so he paid [strongs id="h5414" tvm="8799" /] the fare [strongs id="h7939" /] thereof, and went down [strongs id="h3381" tvm="8799" /] into it, to go [strongs id="h0935" tvm="8800" /] with them unto Tarshish [strongs id="h8659" /] from the presence [strongs id="h6440" /] of the LORD [strongs id="h3068" /].

But the LORD [strongs id="h3068" /] sent out [strongs id="h2904" tvm="8689" /] a great [strongs id="h1419" /] wind [strongs id="h7307" /] into the sea [strongs id="h3220" /], and there was a mighty [strongs id="h1419" /] tempest [strongs id="h5591" /] in the sea [strongs id="h3220" /], so that the ship [strongs id="h0591" /] was like [strongs id="h2803" tvm="8765" /] to be broken [strongs id="h7665" tvm="8736" /].

Then the mariners [strongs id="h4419" /] were afraid [strongs id="h3372" tvm="8799" /], and cried [strongs id="h2199" tvm="8799" /] every man [strongs id="h0376" /] unto his god [strongs id="h0430" /], and cast forth [strongs id="h2904" tvm="8686" /] the wares [strongs id="h3627" /] that [were] in the ship [strongs id="h0591" /] into the sea [strongs id="h3220" /], to lighten [strongs id="h7043" tvm="8687" /] [it] of them. But Jonah [strongs id="h3124" /] was gone down [strongs id="h3381" tvm="8804" /] into the sides [strongs id="h3411" /] of the ship [strongs id="h5600" /]; and he lay [strongs id="h7901" tvm="8799" /], and was fast asleep [strongs id="h7290" tvm="8735" /].

So the shipmaster [strongs id="h7227" /] [strongs id="h2259" /] came [strongs id="h7126" tvm="8799" /] to him, and said [strongs id="h0559" tvm="8799" /] unto him, What meanest thou, O sleeper [strongs id="h7290" tvm="8737" /]? arise [strongs id="h6965" tvm="8798" /], call [strongs id="h7121" tvm="8798" /] upon thy God [strongs id="h0430" /], if so be that God [strongs id="h0430" /] will think [strongs id="h6245" tvm="8691" /] upon us, that we perish [strongs id="h0006" tvm="8799" /] not.

And they said [strongs id="h0559" tvm="8799" /] every one [strongs id="h0376" /] to his fellow [strongs id="h7453" /], Come [strongs id="h3212" tvm="8798" /], and let us cast [strongs id="h5307" tvm="8686" /] lots [strongs id="h1486" /], that we may know [strongs id="h3045" tvm="8799" /] for whose cause [strongs id="h7945" /] this evil [strongs id="h7451" /] [is] upon us. So they cast [strongs id="h5307" tvm="8686" /] lots [strongs id="h1486" /], and the lot [strongs id="h1486" /] fell [strongs id="h5307" tvm="8799" /] upon Jonah [strongs id="h3124" /].

Then said [strongs id="h0559" tvm="8799" /] they unto him, Tell [strongs id="h5046" tvm="8685" /] us, we pray thee, for whose cause this evil [strongs id="h7451" /] [is] upon us; What [is] thine occupation [strongs id="h4399" /]? and whence [strongs id="h0370" /] comest [strongs id="h0935" tvm="8799" /] thou? what [is] thy country [strongs id="h0776" /]? and of what people [strongs id="h5971" /] [art] thou?

And he said [strongs id="h0559" tvm="8799" /] unto them, I [am] an Hebrew [strongs id="h5680" /]; and I fear [strongs id="h3373" /] the LORD [strongs id="h3068" /], the God [strongs id="h0430" /] of heaven [strongs id="h8064" /], which hath made [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8804" /] the sea [strongs id="h3220" /] and the dry [strongs id="h3004" /] [land].

Then were the men [strongs id="h0582" /] exceedingly [strongs id="h1419" /] [strongs id="h3374" /] afraid [strongs id="h3372" tvm="8799" /], and said [strongs id="h0559" tvm="8799" /] unto him, Why hast thou done [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8804" /] this? For the men [strongs id="h0582" /] knew [strongs id="h3045" tvm="8804" /] that he fled [strongs id="h1272" tvm="8802" /] from the presence [strongs id="h6440" /] of the LORD [strongs id="h3068" /], because he had told [strongs id="h5046" tvm="8689" /] them.

Then said [strongs id="h0559" tvm="8799" /] they unto him, What shall we do [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8799" /] unto thee, that the sea [strongs id="h3220" /] may be calm [strongs id="h8367" tvm="8799" /] unto us? for the sea [strongs id="h3220" /] wrought [strongs id="h1980" tvm="8802" /], and was tempestuous [strongs id="h5590" tvm="8802" /].

And he said [strongs id="h0559" tvm="8799" /] unto them, Take me up [strongs id="h5375" tvm="8798" /], and cast me forth [strongs id="h2904" tvm="8685" /] into the sea [strongs id="h3220" /]; so shall the sea [strongs id="h3220" /] be calm [strongs id="h8367" tvm="8799" /] unto you: for I know [strongs id="h3045" tvm="8802" /] that for my sake [strongs id="h7945" /] this great [strongs id="h1419" /] tempest [strongs id="h5591" /] [is] upon you.

Nevertheless the men [strongs id="h0582" /] rowed hard [strongs id="h2864" tvm="8799" /] to bring [strongs id="h7725" tvm="8687" /] [it] to the land [strongs id="h3004" /]; but they could [strongs id="h3201" tvm="8804" /] not: for the sea [strongs id="h3220" /] wrought [strongs id="h1980" tvm="8802" /], and was tempestuous [strongs id="h5590" tvm="8802" /] against them.

Wherefore they cried [strongs id="h7121" tvm="8799" /] unto the LORD [strongs id="h3068" /], and said [strongs id="h0559" tvm="8799" /], We beseech thee [strongs id="h0577" /], O LORD [strongs id="h3068" /], we beseech thee, let us not perish [strongs id="h0006" tvm="8799" /] for this man’s [strongs id="h0376" /] life [strongs id="h5315" /], and lay [strongs id="h5414" tvm="8799" /] not upon us innocent [strongs id="h5355" tvm="8675" /] [strongs id="h5355" /] blood [strongs id="h1818" /]: for thou, O LORD [strongs id="h3068" /], hast done [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8804" /] as it pleased [strongs id="h2654" tvm="8804" /] thee.

So they took up [strongs id="h5375" tvm="8799" /] Jonah [strongs id="h3124" /], and cast him forth [strongs id="h2904" tvm="8686" /] into the sea [strongs id="h3220" /]: and the sea [strongs id="h3220" /] ceased [strongs id="h5975" tvm="8799" /] from her raging [strongs id="h2197" /].

Then the men [strongs id="h0582" /] feared [strongs id="h3372" tvm="8799" /] the LORD [strongs id="h3068" /] exceedingly [strongs id="h1419" /] [strongs id="h3374" /], and offered [strongs id="h2076" tvm="8799" /] a sacrifice [strongs id="h2077" /] unto the LORD [strongs id="h3068" /], and made [strongs id="h5087" tvm="8799" /] vows [strongs id="h5088" /].

Now the LORD [strongs id="h3068" /] had prepared [strongs id="h4487" tvm="8762" /] a great [strongs id="h1419" /] fish [strongs id="h1709" /] to swallow up [strongs id="h1104" tvm="8800" /] Jonah [strongs id="h3124" /]. And Jonah [strongs id="h3124" /] was in the belly [strongs id="h4578" /] of the fish [strongs id="h1709" /] three [strongs id="h7969" /] days [strongs id="h3117" /] and three [strongs id="h7969" /] nights [strongs id="h3915" /].

Then Jonah [strongs id="h3124" /] prayed [strongs id="h6419" tvm="8691" /] unto the LORD [strongs id="h3068" /] his God [strongs id="h0430" /] out of the fish’s [strongs id="h1710" /] belly [strongs id="h4578" /],

And said [strongs id="h0559" tvm="8799" /], I cried [strongs id="h7121" tvm="8804" /] by reason of mine affliction [strongs id="h6869" /] unto the LORD [strongs id="h3068" /], and he heard [strongs id="h6030" tvm="8799" /] me; out of the belly [strongs id="h0990" /] of hell [strongs id="h7585" /] cried [strongs id="h7768" tvm="8765" /] I, [and] thou heardest [strongs id="h8085" tvm="8804" /] my voice [strongs id="h6963" /].

For thou hadst cast [strongs id="h7993" tvm="8686" /] me into the deep [strongs id="h4688" /], in the midst [strongs id="h3824" /] of the seas [strongs id="h3220" /]; and the floods [strongs id="h5104" /] compassed [strongs id="h5437" tvm="8779" /] me about: all thy billows [strongs id="h4867" /] and thy waves [strongs id="h1530" /] passed over [strongs id="h5674" tvm="8804" /] me.

Then I said [strongs id="h0559" tvm="8804" /], I am cast out [strongs id="h1644" tvm="8738" /] of thy sight [strongs id="h5869" /]; yet I will look [strongs id="h5027" tvm="8687" /] again [strongs id="h3254" tvm="8686" /] toward thy holy [strongs id="h6944" /] temple [strongs id="h1964" /].

The waters [strongs id="h4325" /] compassed me about [strongs id="h0661" tvm="8804" /], [even] to the soul [strongs id="h5315" /]: the depth [strongs id="h8415" /] closed me round about [strongs id="h5437" tvm="8779" /], the weeds [strongs id="h5488" /] were wrapped about [strongs id="h2280" tvm="8803" /] my head [strongs id="h7218" /].

I went down [strongs id="h3381" tvm="8804" /] to the bottoms [strongs id="h7095" /] of the mountains [strongs id="h2022" /]; the earth [strongs id="h0776" /] with her bars [strongs id="h1280" /] [was] about me for ever [strongs id="h5769" /]: yet hast thou brought up [strongs id="h5927" tvm="8686" /] my life [strongs id="h2416" /] from corruption [strongs id="h7845" /], O LORD [strongs id="h3068" /] my God [strongs id="h0430" /].

When my soul [strongs id="h5315" /] fainted [strongs id="h5848" tvm="8692" /] within me I remembered [strongs id="h2142" tvm="8804" /] the LORD [strongs id="h3068" /]: and my prayer [strongs id="h8605" /] came in [strongs id="h0935" tvm="8799" /] unto thee, into thine holy [strongs id="h6944" /] temple [strongs id="h1964" /].
They that observe [strongs id="h8104" tvm="8764" /] lying [strongs id="h7723" /] vanities [strongs id="h1892" /] forsake [strongs id="h5800" tvm="8799" /] their own mercy [strongs id="h2617" /].

But I will sacrifice [strongs id="h2076" tvm="8799" /] unto thee with the voice [strongs id="h6963" /] of thanksgiving [strongs id="h8426" /]; I will pay [strongs id="h7999" tvm="8762" /] [that] that I have vowed [strongs id="h5087" tvm="8804" /]. Salvation [strongs id="h3444" /] [is] of the LORD [strongs id="h3068" /].

And the LORD [strongs id="h3068" /] spake [strongs id="h0559" tvm="8799" /] unto the fish [strongs id="h1709" /], and it vomited out [strongs id="h6958" tvm="8686" /] Jonah [strongs id="h3124" /] upon the dry [strongs id="h3004" /] [land].
And the word [strongs id="h1697" /] of the LORD [strongs id="h3068" /] came unto Jonah [strongs id="h3124" /] the second [strongs id="h8145" /] time, saying [strongs id="h0559" tvm="8800" /],

Arise [strongs id="h6965" tvm="8798" /], go [strongs id="h3212" tvm="8798" /] unto Nineveh [strongs id="h5210" /], that great [strongs id="h1419" /] city [strongs id="h5892" /], and preach [strongs id="h7121" tvm="8798" /] unto it the preaching [strongs id="h7150" /] that I bid [strongs id="h1696" tvm="8802" /] thee.

So Jonah [strongs id="h3124" /] arose [strongs id="h6965" tvm="8799" /], and went [strongs id="h3212" tvm="8799" /] unto Nineveh [strongs id="h5210" /], according to the word [strongs id="h1697" /] of the LORD [strongs id="h3068" /]. Now Nineveh [strongs id="h5210" /] was an exceeding [strongs id="h0430" /] great [strongs id="h1419" /] city [strongs id="h5892" /] of three [strongs id="h7969" /] days [strongs id="h3117" /]’ journey [strongs id="h4109" /].

And Jonah [strongs id="h3124" /] began [strongs id="h2490" tvm="8686" /] to enter [strongs id="h0935" tvm="8800" /] into the city [strongs id="h5892" /] a [strongs id="h0259" /] day’s [strongs id="h3117" /] journey [strongs id="h4109" /], and he cried [strongs id="h7121" tvm="8799" /], and said [strongs id="h0559" tvm="8799" /], Yet forty [strongs id="h0705" /] days [strongs id="h3117" /], and Nineveh [strongs id="h5210" /] shall be overthrown [strongs id="h2015" tvm="8737" /].

So the people [strongs id="h0582" /] of Nineveh [strongs id="h5210" /] believed [strongs id="h0539" tvm="8686" /] God [strongs id="h0430" /], and proclaimed [strongs id="h7121" tvm="8799" /] a fast [strongs id="h6685" /], and put [strongs id="h3847" tvm="8799" /] on sackcloth [strongs id="h8242" /], from the greatest [strongs id="h1419" /] of them even to the least [strongs id="h6996" /] of them.

For word [strongs id="h1697" /] came [strongs id="h5060" tvm="8799" /] unto the king [strongs id="h4428" /] of Nineveh [strongs id="h5210" /], and he arose [strongs id="h6965" tvm="8799" /] from his throne [strongs id="h3678" /], and he laid [strongs id="h5674" tvm="8686" /] his robe [strongs id="h0155" /] from him, and covered [strongs id="h3680" tvm="8762" /] [him] with sackcloth [strongs id="h8242" /], and sat [strongs id="h3427" tvm="8799" /] in ashes [strongs id="h0665" /].

And he caused [it] to be proclaimed [strongs id="h2199" tvm="8686" /] and published [strongs id="h0559" tvm="8799" /] through Nineveh [strongs id="h5210" /] by the decree [strongs id="h2940" /] of the king [strongs id="h4428" /] and his nobles [strongs id="h1419" /], saying [strongs id="h0559" tvm="8800" /], Let neither man [strongs id="h0120" /] nor beast [strongs id="h0929" /], herd [strongs id="h1241" /] nor flock [strongs id="h6629" /], taste [strongs id="h2938" tvm="8799" /] any thing [strongs id="h3972" /]: let them not feed [strongs id="h7462" tvm="8799" /], nor drink [strongs id="h8354" tvm="8799" /] water [strongs id="h4325" /]:

But let man [strongs id="h0120" /] and beast [strongs id="h0929" /] be covered [strongs id="h3680" tvm="8691" /] with sackcloth [strongs id="h8242" /], and cry [strongs id="h7121" tvm="8799" /] mightily [strongs id="h2394" /] unto God [strongs id="h0430" /]: yea, let them turn [strongs id="h7725" tvm="8799" /] every one [strongs id="h0376" /] from his evil [strongs id="h7451" /] way [strongs id="h1870" /], and from the violence [strongs id="h2555" /] that [is] in their hands [strongs id="h3709" /].

Who can tell [strongs id="h3045" tvm="8802" /] [if] God [strongs id="h0430" /] will turn [strongs id="h7725" tvm="8799" /] and repent [strongs id="h5162" tvm="8738" /], and turn away [strongs id="h7725" tvm="8804" /] from his fierce [strongs id="h2740" /] anger [strongs id="h0639" /], that we perish [strongs id="h0006" tvm="8799" /] not?

And God [strongs id="h0430" /] saw [strongs id="h7200" tvm="8799" /] their works [strongs id="h4639" /], that they turned [strongs id="h7725" tvm="8804" /] from their evil [strongs id="h7451" /] way [strongs id="h1870" /]; and God [strongs id="h0430" /] repented [strongs id="h5162" tvm="8735" /] of the evil [strongs id="h7451" /], that he had said [strongs id="h1696" tvm="8765" /] that he would do [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8800" /] unto them; and he did [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8804" /] [it] not.
But it displeased [strongs id="h3415" tvm="8799" /] Jonah [strongs id="h3124" /] exceedingly [strongs id="h1419" /] [strongs id="h7451" /], and he was very angry [strongs id="h2734" tvm="8799" /].

And he prayed [strongs id="h6419" tvm="8691" /] unto the LORD [strongs id="h3068" /], and said [strongs id="h0559" tvm="8799" /], I pray [strongs id="h0577" /] thee, O LORD [strongs id="h3068" /], [was] not this my saying [strongs id="h1697" /], when I was yet in my country [strongs id="h0127" /]? Therefore I fled [strongs id="h1272" tvm="8800" /] before [strongs id="h6923" tvm="8765" /] unto Tarshish [strongs id="h8659" /]: for I knew [strongs id="h3045" tvm="8804" /] that thou [art] a gracious [strongs id="h2587" /] God [strongs id="h0410" /], and merciful [strongs id="h7349" /], slow [strongs id="h0750" /] to anger [strongs id="h0639" /], and of great [strongs id="h7227" /] kindness [strongs id="h2617" /], and repentest [strongs id="h5162" tvm="8737" /] thee of the evil [strongs id="h7451" /].

Therefore now, O LORD [strongs id="h3068" /], take [strongs id="h3947" tvm="8798" /], I beseech thee, my life [strongs id="h5315" /] from me; for [it is] better [strongs id="h2896" /] for me to die [strongs id="h4194" /] than to live [strongs id="h2416" /].
Then said [strongs id="h0559" tvm="8799" /] the LORD [strongs id="h3068" /], Doest thou well [strongs id="h3190" tvm="8687" /] to be angry [strongs id="h2734" tvm="8804" /]?

So Jonah [strongs id="h3124" /] went out [strongs id="h3318" tvm="8799" /] of the city [strongs id="h5892" /], and sat [strongs id="h3427" tvm="8799" /] on the east side [strongs id="h6924" /] of the city [strongs id="h5892" /], and there made [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8799" /] him a booth [strongs id="h5521" /], and sat [strongs id="h3427" tvm="8799" /] under it in the shadow [strongs id="h6738" /], till he might see [strongs id="h7200" tvm="8799" /] what would become of the city [strongs id="h5892" /].

And the LORD [strongs id="h3068" /] God [strongs id="h0430" /] prepared [strongs id="h4487" tvm="8762" /] a gourd [strongs id="h7021" /], and made [it] to come up [strongs id="h5927" tvm="8799" /] over Jonah [strongs id="h3124" /], that it might be a shadow [strongs id="h6738" /] over his head [strongs id="h7218" /], to deliver [strongs id="h5337" tvm="8687" /] him from his grief [strongs id="h7451" /]. So Jonah [strongs id="h3124" /] was exceeding [strongs id="h1419" /] [strongs id="h8057" /] glad [strongs id="h8055" tvm="8799" /] of the gourd [strongs id="h7021" /].

But God [strongs id="h0430" /] prepared [strongs id="h4487" tvm="8762" /] a worm [strongs id="h8438" /] when the morning [strongs id="h7837" /] rose [strongs id="h5927" tvm="8800" /] the next day [strongs id="h4283" /], and it smote [strongs id="h5221" tvm="8686" /] the gourd [strongs id="h7021" /] that it withered [strongs id="h3001" tvm="8799" /].

And it came to pass, when the sun [strongs id="h8121" /] did arise [strongs id="h2224" tvm="8800" /], that God [strongs id="h0430" /] prepared [strongs id="h4487" tvm="8762" /] a vehement [strongs id="h2759" /] east [strongs id="h6921" /] wind [strongs id="h7307" /]; and the sun [strongs id="h8121" /] beat [strongs id="h5221" tvm="8686" /] upon the head [strongs id="h7218" /] of Jonah [strongs id="h3124" /], that he fainted [strongs id="h5968" tvm="8691" /], and wished [strongs id="h7592" tvm="8799" /] in himself [strongs id="h5315" /] to die [strongs id="h4191" tvm="8800" /], and said [strongs id="h0559" tvm="8799" /], [It is] better [strongs id="h2896" /] for me to die [strongs id="h4194" /] than to live [strongs id="h2416" /].

And God [strongs id="h0430" /] said [strongs id="h0559" tvm="8799" /] to Jonah [strongs id="h3124" /], Doest thou well [strongs id="h3190" tvm="8687" /] to be angry [strongs id="h2734" tvm="8804" /] for the gourd [strongs id="h7021" /]?
